body: Sure no problem! I have squashed the commits.

The results are available at https://ci.apache.org/projects/syncope/2_1_X/getting-started.html#docker-compose-samples and will appear at https://syncope.apache.org/docs/getting-started.html#docker-compose-samples as soon as 2.1.1 is officially released (I expect soon).
This PR is for SYNCOPE-1220 (auto-link to JIRA)

Thanks for this PR @mornindew - I'll review it in few days.
Meanwhile: have you already submitted your ICLA? http://www.apache.org/licenses/#clas

Please ensure that all new files contain the correct license header, or build will fail; for YAML, you can grab it from https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/docker/src/main/resources/docker-compose-ha.yml - e.g. your YAML files should start with content:

```
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
# distributed with this work for additional information
# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
# specific language governing permissions and limitations
# under the License.

```
Made the recommended changes

Thanks @mornindew 

Could you please rebase your changes to latest `master` and squash your commits into one only? Thanks.

And what about ICLA? Did you submit it?
ping @mornindew

Thanks for your contribution: see it on-line at https://ci.apache.org/projects/syncope/2_1_X/getting-started.html#kubernetes-sample

As you can see, I did some minor editing and reflow.

That call is *not* redundant, it is invoking the `after()` method with any defined pull actions.
Please close this PR.

@AlexTsvetkov I have reviewed the code in `DefaultRealmPullResultHandler` and found that you were right about removing the additional `after()` calls - as proposed in #84 .

This because the `link()` method eventually calls `update()` - thus I have tried to clean up a bit the call hierarchy in 5e854e117594da3a1ba78c0af8d53d89a66a9c5a

Please close this PR as well, sorry for the noise; at least, now the issue should be fixed.

For future contributions, please submit an [ICLA](http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F), thanks.
Please submit your [ICLA](http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F) before we can accept your contributions.
Thanks for your contribution @AlexTsvetkov - please do not forget to submit your ICLA.
please squash my commits with last commit message
Thanks @AlexTsvetkov
LGTM
@coheigea any blocker for you to go ahead and merge?
@ilgrosso Please go ahead and merge it to all branches you consider appropriate
@coheigea done for master branch, cherry-picking to 2_0_X and 2_1_X

@Dmitriy333 as discussed via mail, about the proposed `passwordNeverExpires`, I don't see rationale for adding fields to the `SyncopeUser` entity; you can achieve the same purpose by simply defining a boolean Plain Schema.

About initially setting `changePwdDate` at user creation, please go ahead and open an issue on JIRA, then create a PR on with a commit message mentioning such issue, thanks.
@Dmitriy333 if you plan to contribute, please also submit your ICLA as described in http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F
No feedback for 5 days - @Dmitriy333 shall we close this PR?
Closing, no feedback for 8 days in total.

LGTM

I would have actually preferred if there were some constants around for `X-Frame-Options`, `X-XSS-Protection` etc. (from dependencies I mean, not in Syncope) but it seems that only Spring Security has something (as [1](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/blob/master/web/src/main/java/org/springframework/security/web/server/header/XFrameOptionsServerHttpHeadersWriter.java#L28) or [2](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/blob/master/web/src/main/java/org/springframework/security/web/server/header/XXssProtectionServerHttpHeadersWriter.java#L29)).

> I created the PR against 2.1.x, as I'm not sure what state master is currently in.

Don't worry: once merged, I'll take care of cherry-picking against `2_0_X` and `master` branches.

@ilgrosso , sorry for the delay. I have to create Pull Request from the new account.
Created it here https://github.com/apache/syncope/pull/97

@DmitriyBrashevets LGTM, but please:
1. submit your ICLA: http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F
1. open an issue on JIRA about this improvement, and mention the issue number (e.g. `SYNCOPE-XXXX` in your commit message)

Thanks!

1. Sent my ICLA to root@apache.org.
2. Ticket in Jira https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYNCOPE-1438

Ah, I have seen your ICLA, and that you opened SYNCOPE-1438 - thanks!
Would it be possible to change your commit message to include the string `SYNCOPE-1438`?
Updated commit message
Merged, thanks!
FYI, I have also cherry-picked your commit into the `2_1_X` and `master` branches.

Hi @longstone , thanks for this PR.
The change you are proposing looks generally fine to me - I would like to double-check before merging, anyway.

Meanwhile, please:

1. open an issue on [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SYNCOPE/)
1. change the commit log message to include the issue number (something like as `[SYNCOPE-XXXX] <the current log message>`
1. submit your ICLA, as explained [here](http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F)

Thanks!

As noted above, [DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry#containsSingleton](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/master/spring-beans/src/main/java/org/springframework/beans/factory/support/DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry.java#L285) is backed by a `ConcurrentHashMap`, the same map used by [DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry#registerSingleton](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/master/spring-beans/src/main/java/org/springframework/beans/factory/support/DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry.java#L114).
As you can see there, the code already does synchronization on that map and raises an `IllegalStateException` in case a ben with the given name is already present.

Given the implementation in Spring, I think that SYNCOPE-1488 should be fixed on Syncope in a completely different way, e.g. simply catching and logging the `IllegalStateException`, as all the needed concurrency control is - correctly BTW - performed by Spring code.

I faced the issue when using syncope and therefore the hashmap is not securing the registration of the beans. Maybe I messed up with version. 
However, this part is not Threadsafe and an exception is thrown when registering a bean which is already registered.
Give me some time. Maybe weekend. I try to create some unit test
I submitted a test. Synchronized Map guarantees atomic operations on the HashMap. The fix I'm supposing is handling it on a different Level.
Thanks, I'll take a look. Meanwhile, please add the license header to the new class, otherwise checks will fail anyway.

@longstone I attempted to run your add test against `master` branch, and it failed as expected, good.

Then I applied my suggested fix (catch and log `IllegalStateException`) and now it passes: I have committed such alternative fix into the [SYNCOPE-1448_alternative-fix](https://github.com/apache/syncope/tree/SYNCOPE-1448_alternative-fix) branch, if you want to take a look.

> you're first few threads will may not have the "same" bean, as they instantiate it for it own -> I can't judge what possible side effects may be

you are right, please see the updated class in the `SYNCOPE-1448_alternative-fix` branch.

> we (and the customers) will find a WARN message in the log -> would be great if can be changed to info or debug?

To me, `warn` makes more sense, but I'll go with `debug` if you ask so.
@longstone are you ok with the alternative fix, after last changes I made yesterday? Shall I go ahead and merge that to `master` and `2_1_X`?
no feedback for 6 days, I went ahead and fixed via 50469a15b51b99e6b1e52a05626f96e0b9ce6cdd
Rebased on 2_0_X since you've added the commit https://github.com/apache/syncope/commit/85aadb3cd826d34e984540990187552437aa9236 and I had the conflicts

Thank you very much @DmitriyBrashevets !

Also merged to:
* `2_1_X` via ac58796c8fc10b484389b63abca1182297768224
* `master` via 37c6aacd0dbfccdea7e98c95c94aea882b563d1b

(with some minor modifications)

Hi @mmoayyed thanks for your willing to contribute!
If you haven't done so yet, please [submit your ICLA](http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F).

About this PR, I am not sure to understand its purpose: the code on `master` branch is already 100% compatible with JDK 11 - we have at least three jobs running on that:
* Travis CI: (latest is https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/builds/514204307)
* AppVeyor: (latest is https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/syncope/builds/23511224)
* Jenkins: https://builds.apache.org/view/S-Z/view/Syncope/job/Syncope-master-deploy/

SYNCOPE-1332 is about reviewing the Java code to use language features introduced after Java 8, I don't expect any change required in the build process.
Hi @mmoayyed are you still working on this? Shall we close this and re-open a new one, only for Java 11 language features?

Hello there, I am no longer working on this so please go ahead and close. I am still unable to use IntelliJ IDEA to build and run the project, and I am going to keep the changes private for now. I'll try to get the CLA submitted in the coming days which would then allow me to work on other tasks such as Java 11 features. Thanks for following up. Appreciate your time looking into this!
Thanks for your feedback @mmoayyed - looking fwd to see your contributions!

This first commit aims to set the the first part of the persistence layer for the AM module. I have implemented the interfaces for authentication policies, modules and chains. I provided for each entity the possibility of adding implementations.
I created a pull request because there are some interfaces that still need to be implemented / modified (missing dependency, new module, etc etc ), so before continuing I would like to have feedback from you.

Hi @rshoesmi thanks for your contribution.
Can you please provide some background? Why do you think such change is needed?
Sycope would not start up after switching to the file based H2 database as described in the documentation. Adding the database name to the jdbc url fixed the problem.

Sorry, I cannot replicate the issue you describe: following the docs as they are right now worked fine for me (on Linux); the following files were created in my home directory, as expected:

* syncopedb.mv.db
* syncopedb.trace.db

With your suggested changes, the following files, instead, again as expected:

* syncopedb:syncopedb.mv.db
* syncopedb:syncopedb.trace.db

Are you on a different platform than Linux?

Anyway, can you please report the error you get when following the current docs?

This was on macOS Mojave 10.14.5.

I deleted all the database files to start fresh and it's working now. Perhaps they got corrupted somehow.
Ah ok, glad it works now for you anyway!
Thanks for this OR @mmoayyed - please also remove the Netbeans repo in the root `pom.xml`, thanks.
LGTM thanks @mmoayyed !
Sure. Done.

Changes look good.

```
[WARNING] Supported source version 'RELEASE_7' from annotation processor 'org.netbeans.api.annotations.common.proc.StaticResourceProcessor' less than -source '11'
```

Finally, could you please also check if the Netbeans plugin is effectively working as expected? See http://syncope.apache.org/docs/2.1/getting-started.html#netbeans-ide-plugin for instructions.

Thanks!

The plugin loads, installs and seems to work OK:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1205228/64168400-b0ce4080-ce60-11e9-8e28-fb821e2f4db1.png)
Thanks @mmoayyed !
@mmoayyed The codebase is full of `Arrays.asList()` or similar, thanks for cleaning this up!
Sure thing. Updated the pull to catch all.
Thanks @mmoayyed - honestly I did not check every bit, but globally things look fine - and Travis CI is green, enough to me ;-)
Thanks @mmoayyed :+1:
@mmoayyed the changes included here seem to fail the build - see https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/builds/580651810
This seems to be OK, but we have a failure on appveyor. Is that relevant or related?
AppVeyor is more fragile, we keep it mostly to check that build runs on Windows
Reset the few formatting changes. Hope it looks better now.
Could we restart the AppVeyor build to see if it might pass again? It's probably, as you note, related to the fragility of the platform and not a real failure.

I have no karma to trigger AppVeyor manually, we need a new commit in this PR: just address my latest comments and push a new commit, it should be enough.
Anyway, don't worry too much about AppVeyor...
Updated build to address comments, and also converted a bunch more singleton calls to the immutable API calls. Waiting for CI to confirm changes...
I might need some help troubleshooting failures here; integration tests are failing and it seems rather difficult to debug and diagnose issues. What's the best approach in debugging an IT?

@mmoayyed cd to `fit/core-reference` and start via `mvn -Pdebug,all`, then attach your JPDA debugger to localhost:8000.

You can execute a single test via

```
mvn test -Dtest=RESTITCase#exportInternalStorageContent
```

Finally, please consider that `PullTaskITCase#reconcileFromLDAP` sometimes just fail (the logic behind is quite complex and difficult to synchronize accurately).
Nice job @mmoayyed !

Thanks. I think I have finally caught and got the hang of this, but this will likely take a few more commits to verify on CI. The cargo plugin seems quite sensitive when it comes to debugging tests, and things hang and ports remain occupied. (It's also likely me, but it does take an unusual amount of time to start the deployment).

> The cargo plugin seems quite sensitive when it comes to debugging tests, and things hang and ports remain occupied. (It's also likely me, but it does take an unusual amount of time to start the deployment).

Oh, this sounds strange: I don't have such issues (nor I heard of others), but there might be something with OS X, as you're likely the first one with such OS.
Manually merged (due to conflicts) in 61385632208864e645e7a33d2db962c2fd8c99fd - thanks @mmoayyed !

Manually merged (due to conflicts) in  6864923b61c395b7be3bcf2e10b5d50aea547515 - thanks @mmoayyed !

Please also note I had to keep https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/fit/core-reference/src/test/java/org/apache/syncope/fit/core/PullTaskITCase.java#L411 because `Map.of()` does not allow for `null` values (and we need exactly that, there).

@pwd3 not sure why you need to build Syncope sources - normally, you'd do this only if willing to contribute fixes or features.
If you have more questions about this, please send an e-mail to the user@ ML.

Regarding the proposed changes here, please add instructions for Debian or derivatives as follows:

```sudo apt install patch```

In case you are planning to further contribute to Syncope, please fill and send your ICLA: http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F
Ah, also change your commit message / PR title to include `SYNCOPE-1487` so that JIRA gets automatically linked, thanks.
So this PR is for SYNCOPE-1487 and SYNCOPE-1488 ?

@DmitriyBrashevets as you can see, with your changes there is a failure with `SearchITCase#issueSYNCOPE1223`

Please have a look at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYNCOPE-1223 and see if your proposed change does make sense, thanks.

> @DmitriyBrashevets as you can see, with your changes there is a failure with `SearchITCase#issueSYNCOPE1223`
> 
> Please have a look at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYNCOPE-1223 and see if your proposed change does make sense, thanks.

Hi @ilgrosso. Thanks for your reply. I see now..
Does it mean that I first need to encode filter property values (to support commas) and after this, I need to encode full fiql string?

Code sample:
```java
String fiqlString = SyncopeClient.getUserSearchConditionBuilder()
                .is("phone").equalTo(utf8Encode("+1234556789112"))
                .query();
AnyQuery anyQuery = new AnyQuery.Builder().realm(SyncopeConstants.ROOT_REALM).fiql(utf8Encode(fiqlString)).build();
PagedResult<UserTO> matchingUsers = userService.search(anyQuery);
```

If so, I'll close the PR and corresponding bug that I created in JIRA.

> Does it mean that I first need to encode filter property values (to support commas) and after this, I need to encode full fiql string?

Yes, please look at my comment in JIRA.
Reworking this PR as 4b24ca7643b618e734ee8e0cb10287cb29e4ddd5
@mmoayyed thanks for this PR and also for fixing Javadocs!

This LGTM as far as the changeset goes, but we do have a few failures:

```
[ERROR] Failures: 
[ERROR]   PullTaskITCase.reconcileFromLDAP:444 expected: <null> but was: <org.apache.syncope.common.lib.Attr@f36afeef>
[ERROR]   PushTaskITCase.pushMatchingUser:238 expected: <false> but was: <true>
```

The usual suspect being `PullTaskITCase.reconcileFromLDAP`, but I'm not sure if the other failure is related here.

I restarted [the job](https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/jobs/583994953) to see if this is permanent - as you can see, no such errors in https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/builds/583713228 (latest `master` build).

Hey, the tests are passing now, but the job is still failing: https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/jobs/583994953

Why?!?

Seems related to:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:ianal-maven-plugin:1.0-alpha-1:verify-legal-files (default) on project syncope-fit-core-reference: Artifact does not contain any legal files: syncope-fit-core-reference-3.0.0-SNAPSHOT.war -> [Help 1]
```

I turned off the legal file check for the verification phase.

It seems last run failed at last stage: https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/jobs/584042105

and the reason was

```
The job exceeded the maximum log length, and has been terminated.
```

Moreover:
1. do you think my comment above, about `modernizer-maven-plugin` can be easily addressed?
1. can we add a stage before IT which runs unit tests, e.g. something like as `mvn clean package` from root?

1. Modernizer should already be included in previous commits. Please see https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/builds/584042094?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification in the `Validate` phase. 
2. Sure. I'll add that too.
Closing PR for now to minimize notifications. Will re-open again once the changeset is ready again.

I had to take out the versions plugin; it's quite inefficient it seems and takes a very long time to complete. Dependency updates (and reports at least) can be automated in different and better ways in the future.
Hey @mmoayyed Travis is finally green (and AppVeyour is red but due to the usual instability); since your changes look very good to me, shall I just go ahead and merge?!?

I was wondering: if all methods from *RestClient classes are now static, why are such classes still instantiated?

I would then also remove all statements like as https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/client/idrepo/console/src/main/java/org/apache/syncope/client/console/status/ChangePasswordModal.java#L47 and turn all instance invocations into static invocations.

> I was wondering: if all methods from *RestClient classes are now static, why are such classes still instantiated?

Sure thing; I'll re-adjust. I originally positioned the analysis to only affect candidate methods marked as private to avoid compile issues; now after this pass, we can certainly clean up some more :)
I added two additional tests in the verification phase to test content-type values for YAML, etc. Looks like tests are failing with NPEs. Are these still valid tests and should I look into them?

Well, in principle they should just work but in practice I don't think that YAML or XML are much used...

I'd propose to remove (comment out?) the last two stages from Travis CI for the moment, then open two issues on JIRA for the test issues; when such issues are resolved we can also re-enable the stages.

WDYT?
